definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: With each new technology that is introduced, people like to experiment and test the tipping point.
sentences.chinese: 当新技术出现时，人们总是试验和测试它的燃点。

sentences.english: Burn candles on a flat, stable, heat-resistant surface.
sentences.chinese: 将蜡烛放在平稳及耐热的平面上燃点。

sentences.english: In the program, everybody also again mentioned that Beijing Olympic Games opening ceremony ignites the ceremonial fire incident.
sentences.chinese: 节目中，大家又再提到北京奥运开幕式燃点圣火一事。

sentences.english: I stood and watched her light uselessly burning in the void.
sentences.chinese: 我站着看她的灯光在天空中无用的燃点着。
喇嘛燃点供佛的酥油灯。

sentences.english: Ignite the spark of romance with this collection of Italian Love Songs.
sentences.chinese: 用这张义大利情歌音乐集，为你燃点起浪漫的火花。

sentences.english: I stood and watched her little lamp uselessly lost among lights.
sentences.chinese: 我站著看她的灯光在天空中无用的燃点著。

definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
